name: Free Online Citation Formatter (APA/MLA/Chicago/IEEE/GB/T 7714) - ATools
description: Free online citation formatter for APA 7, MLA 9, Chicago, IEEE, and GB/T 7714. Fill in authors/title/journal or website info and copy the result. Runs locally.
seoDescription: Free online citation formatter that generates common reference entries for APA 7, MLA 9, Chicago, IEEE, and a simplified GB/T 7714. Enter authors, title, journal/publisher, dates, URL/DOI, and copy the formatted citation. Runs locally with zero uploads, useful for papers, reports, and quick bibliography formatting.

ui.hint: Citation formatter: fill in author/title/journal or website fields and generate APA / MLA / Chicago / IEEE / GB/T 7714 citations (local only, no uploads).
ui.parseTitle: Parse a citation (paste an existing entry and auto-detect style)
ui.parsePlaceholder:
Paste one citation/reference entry (APA/MLA/Chicago/IEEE/GB/T 7714) and click “Parse & apply”.
Example:
[1] A. B. Smith, "Title," Journal, vol. 1, no. 2, pp. 3-4, 2020, doi: 10.xxx/yyy.
Or:
Zhang, S., & Li, S. (2020). Title. Journal, 1(2), 3-4. https://doi.org/10.xxx/yyy
ui.authorsPlaceholder:
Examples:
Zhang, San
Li, Si
or:
San Zhang
Si Li
ui.title: Title
ui.yearOptionalHint: Tip: if the year is missing, the formatter may omit it or use n.d. depending on style.
ui.missingAuthors: Missing authors (you can leave blank and use organization/site name instead)
ui.missingContainer: Missing container/journal/site name (some styles can omit it)
ui.missingPublisher: Missing publisher (for books and some webpages)
ui.missingUrl: Missing URL/DOI (webpages typically need a URL)
